text:
Beattie is a city in Marshall County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 200 people lived there. The city has been called "The Milo Capital of the World" and hosts the annual "Beattie Milo Festival".
History.
Beattie was planned out in 1870. It is named after Armstrong Beattie, the eighth Mayor of St. Joseph, Missouri.
The first post office in Beattie was created in July 1871.
Geography.
Beattie is at (39.861736, -96.419091). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 200 people, 90 households, and 51 families living in Beattie.
